intersect(IntersectionRecord, Ray) - Method in class ray.surface.MeshTriangle
This simply copies the triangle intersection method from Triangle, but reads the vertex data from the mesh array and computes the normals from the normal array (if present) The implemented method closely follows the Cramer's rule method described on page 208 of Shirley.

ProjSolidAngleIlluminator - Class in ray.renderer
This class computes direct illumination at a surface by the simplest possible approach: it estimates the integral of incident direct radiance using Monte Carlo integration with a uniform sampling distribution.

rayRadiance(Scene, Ray, SampleGenerator, int, Color) - Method in class ray.renderer.AmbientOcclusion
Evaluates the illumination component to the camera along the given Ray under the "ambient occlusion" assumption, where rays reach the bounding box increase the brightness of the surface, whereas a ray which hits any other object contributes no radiance
